title: ICE with proc_macro_attribute on pub(super) function in module

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: A-macros
labels.description: Area: All kinds of macros (custom derive, macro_rules!, proc macros, ..)

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Compiler panicks when there is function with both `#[proc_macro_attribute]` and `pub(super)` defined in module (not in the root of the crate).

`lib.rs`:
```rust
mod m;
```

`m.rs`:
```rust
// This function makes compiler panick:
#[proc_macro_attribute]
pub(super) fn pub_super() {}
```

All following functions successfully does not compile (which is fine):
```rust
// error: functions tagged with `#[proc_macro_attribute]` must currently reside in the root of the crate

#[proc_macro_attribute]
pub(crate) fn pub_crate() {}

#[proc_macro_attribute]
pub fn just_pub() {}

#[proc_macro_attribute]
fn nothing() {}
```

```
$ rustc --crate-type proc-macro lib.rs

thread 'rustc' panicked at 'path resolved multiple times (PartialRes { base_res: Def(Mod, DefId(0:0)), unresolved_segments: 0 } before, PartialRes { base_res: Def(Mod, DefId(0:0)), unresolved_segments: 0 } now)', src/librustc_resolve/lib.rs:2414:13
note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace

error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic
note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.
note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports

note: rustc 1.43.0-nightly (58b834344 2020-02-05) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu

note: compiler flags: --crate-type proc-macro
```
<details>
  <summary>RUST_BACKTRACE=1</summary>

```

error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic

note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.

note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports

note: rustc 1.43.0-nightly (58b834344 2020-02-05) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu

note: compiler flags: --crate-type proc-macro

query stack during panic:
end of query stack
```

`RUST_BACKTRACE=full` log is available here: https://gist.github.com/iliakonnov/8dbf25041e46c3861f4e1cf2237315f8#file-backtrace-full-log
</details>

I expected to see ``error: functions tagged with `#[proc_macro_attribute]` must currently reside in the root of the crate`` instead of ICE
```
$ rustc --version --verbose
rustc 1.43.0-nightly (58b834344 2020-02-05)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 58b834344fc7b9185e7a50db1ff24e5eb07dae5e
commit-date: 2020-02-05
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
release: 1.43.0-nightly
LLVM version: 9.0
```

UPD: Also reproduces without `--crate-type proc-macro`. Just `rustc lib.rs` is enough
